line: The little Poem now presented to the Public, was intended for publication

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: immediately after the appearance of the "Peacock at Home," but from various

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: causes, was laid aside till now. In the opinion of the Publisher, however,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: it is so nearly allied in point of merit to that celebrated Trifle, that he

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: is induced, although at this late period, to print it with a few

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: appropriate embellishments.

line: Ye votaries of Fashion, who have it to boast,

line: That your names to posterity will not be lost;

line: That the last _Morning Chronicle_ due honor paid

line: To the still-blooming Dowager's gay Masquerade;

line: That the Minister's Dinner has blaz'd in _the Times_,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: That the Countess's Gala has jingled in rhymes;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Oh! tell me, who would not endeavour to please,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And exert ev'ry nerve, for rewards such as these?

line: It was early in Spring--but no matter what year,                    [p 6]

line: That the PEACOCK, delighting in noise, and good cheer,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Determin'd, for dear notoriety's sake,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: A dash in the whirlpool of Fashion to make.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: A Concert and Ball, their attractions united,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: To which the _Beau-Monde_ were politely invited.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Away they all flew, it was heavenly weather,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And soon at the PEACOCK'S arriv'd, in full feather.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The scene was enchanting! for taste so refin'd

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Had never appear'd with such splendor combin'd.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The Dance was all gaiety, frolic, and glee;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The Music transporting! the Supper _exquis_!

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The Beaux were all _prime_, and the flow'r of the nation,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The Belles were all style, beauty, grace, fascination:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Good humour presided, where pleasure was law,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And the guests, more or less, all came off with _eclat_.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But, alas! Time has wings; and tho' still vastly clever,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: We cannot make Balls last for ever and ever,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: When day was seen breaking, the company parted;                     [p 7]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And none, I am told, ever went lighter hearted.

PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: "I knew," cried SIR ARGUS, "_my_ Gala would shine:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Oh! charming distinction, Oh! pleasure divine.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Yes! _I_ too shall see myself figure away

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: In the records of fashion, the buz of the day;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And the world shall admire, in ages to come,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The brilliant display of the PEACOCK at Home."

PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Two months had now pass'd, and SIR ARGUS, one morning,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Was ruffling his plumes, and his person adorning,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: When lo! from the regions of air, quick descending,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: A PIGEON appear'd, and his neck gently bending,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Presented a Billet; then silently bow'd,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And, spreading his wings, was soon lost in a cloud.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: SIR ARGUS, astonish'd, in haste now uncloses

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The paper, perfum'd with fresh Otto of Roses.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: "In fortune's dear name," he exclaims, "what is this                [p 8]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: '_The Peacock at Home!_' Oh! superlative bliss!

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: My feelings, prophetic, the honor foretold;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Yes! _The Peacock at Home_ shall be printed in gold:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: How just the description! what grace, and what spirit!

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Aye--this is indeed a production of merit."

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Be it known, that the great _Biped Lords of Creation_,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Of _every_ class, and in _every_ station,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: All secretly cherish, what all yet disclaim,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: _That_ feeling, which we _curiosity_ name.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Now our PEACOCK imperial, tho' too proud to own,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: That the fav'rite of Juno had ever been prone

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: To a weakness, he always had _wish'd_ to believe

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Was exclusively felt by the _Daughters of Eve_,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Yet died with impatience to know who had written

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The elegant verses, with which he was smitten.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: His thoughts were all now on discovery bent,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And, in haste, for the PARROT he instantly sent:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Who shortly arriv'd, overjoy'd beyond measure,                      [p 9]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And, strutting, demanded SIR ARGUS'S pleasure?

line: [Illustration: _"The Peacock with vanity fully inflated." p. 9._]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The PEACOCK, with vanity fully inflated,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Erected his plumes, and the triumph related;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Then quiv'ring his wings, and expanding his breast,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The listening PARROT in these words address'd:--

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: "My friend, I acknowledge the Poem divine,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And that genius and wit breathe thro' every line;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But it is not enough that to Fame we devote it,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: You, the Herald of Ton, must inform me who _wrote_ it."

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The PARROT, who now was expiring to speak,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Twirl'd his ebony tongue, and then op'ning his beak,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: In a tone of importance, without hesitation,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Directly began a high-sounding oration.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: "SIR ARGUS, no mortal could e'er have desir'd,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: More exquisite verses than those you've inspir'd.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The Muse has for _you_, indeed, tried all her art,                 [p 10]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And with envy, no doubt, has fill'd many a heart:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: I wonder not, then, you are anxious to know

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: From _whose_ pen these strains of sweet harmony flow.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: 'Tis true, I have chanc'd in my wanderings to meet

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: With _some_ secrets; and _such_ anecdotes _cou'd_ repeat!

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: However, no matter; I give you my word,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: That who wrote this fine Poem, I never yet heard;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But it much wou'd delight me the truth to discover,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Altho' I shou'd fly for it all the world over:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: What say you, SIR ARGUS, the fact to insure,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Suppose we were both to set out on a tour?"

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: "Agreed! my good Sir; far as England extends,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Then together we'll travel, and visit our friends:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Endeavour to find out the name of our Poet,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And e'er we return, ten to one but we know it."

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: A tempting repast they now hastily shar'd,                         [p 11]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Of grain and dried cherries, already prepar'd:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Then sipping some drops from a neighbouring spring,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Made no further delay, but directly took wing.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Awhile they fled on, over meadow, thro' grove,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Delighted, for novelty's sake, thus to rove:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Yet sometimes alighted, preferring a walk,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The PEACOCK for ease, and the PARROT for talk;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Till, at last, poor SIR ARGUS began to complain,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Of the sad inconvenience he felt from his train,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And propos'd, as the sky seem'd to threaten a shower,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: To rest till the morning, at Nightingale Bower;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The obsequious PARROT replied by a bow,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And they went on as fast as their strength would allow.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: PHILOMELA, to whom her retirement was dear,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Felt vex'd at beholding the flutterers near;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: For living in harmony, softness, and quiet,                        [p 12]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: She hated all bustle, intrusion, and riot;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And tho' a _few_ trips to the gay world she made,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Her heart, still unalter'd, remain'd in the shade.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: However, our fair pensive warbler well knew,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Some sacrifice still to politeness was due;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: She, therefore, soon hasten'd the coxcombs to meet;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And welcom'd them both to her rural retreat.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: A delicate supper before them was plac'd,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Not with splendor, indeed, but simplicity grac'd;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: At which she presided with elegant ease,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And that native good breeding, that always must please.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: SIR ARGUS seem'd charm'd, and shew'd great condescension,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Was all affability, grace, and attention:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Till growing impatient, without much preamble,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: He eagerly mention'd the cause of his ramble.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But no information, alas! he receiv'd,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: At which he was hurt, and the NIGHTINGALE griev'd;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But hop'd he wou'd be more successful ere long,                    [p 13]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And propos'd, _en attendant_, to give him a song.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Delighted, he begg'd PHILOMEL would proceed;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: She complied; and 'twas something _like_ singing, indeed.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: No cadence was ever perform'd with such neatness:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Grassini herself never sang with such sweetness.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The favor was next of the PARROT requested,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Who, clearing his throat, was quite hoarse, he protested:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Yet gave "Pretty Poll,"[1] with such fine intonation,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: SIR ARGUS cried "Bravo!" and scream'd approbation.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The Travellers now with fatigue were opprest,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: So they both bade adieu, and retired to rest:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: A sun-shiny morn to their slumbers succeeded,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: When, wak'd to new life, on their way they proceeded.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: A poor captive STARLING, who liv'd near the road,                  [p 14]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: They soon spied, and enquir'd for the Poet's abode:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But 'twas useless, indeed! tho' they made a great rout,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: For he only kept crying, "I cannot get out!"

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: This want of attention the PEACOCK enrag'd,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And he fiercely exclaim'd, "Ha! 'tis well thou art cag'd!

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But, dear Mr. PARROT, methought that I saw

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The gilt Ball on the Dome of the LADY MACAW:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: With _her_ we will breakfast at Aviary Hall,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And who knows what success may our visit befal."

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Now it luckily happened on this very day,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: That the COUNTESS was giving a grand _Dejeuné_;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And she actually started--so great her delight,

line: The most exquisite dainties the Spring wou'd afford,

line: And all only serving to puzzle them more,

line: In the meanwhile, the PARROT with quickness rehearses,

line: Detraction, of late, had been full of employment,

line: And truly, _some_ folks knew no other enjoyment.

line: 'Twas said, tho' for _her_ part, she thought it quite cruel,

line: That Monsieur LE COQ had been kill'd in a _duel_.

line: The _Hedge_-SPARROW publicly swore all was true,

line: That so long had been told of the Tyrant CUCKOO;

line: And the BULLFINCH _did_ whistle indeed to some tune,

line: When he said a _great Pleader_ had stolen a spoon!"

line: "It is false!" cried a little bird, known as a _wag_;

line: "And _I_ would indite him, at once, for _Scan. Mag._"

line: All the Company now rais'd their pinions and eyes,

line: And protested their plumes stood on end with surprise!

line: While young Mrs. PEE-WIT, dear sweet gentle creature!

line: Evinc'd _her_ abhorrence in every feature:

line: Her soft bosom swell'd, and she thought it was grievous,           [p 18]

line: That malice should lead the world thus to deceive us:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: For _she_ too had heard a long, odious relation

line: Of cruel oppression, and vile peculation;

line: And own'd, (tho' it _might_ be as false as the rest,)

line: How ev'ry one star'd! "what detestable stories!"

line: But Phoebus advancing, now brought on the day,

line: And the PEACOCK declar'd he must hasten away.

line: And both to the Countess some compliments paid;

line: But a pure chrystal stream _some_ refreshment afforded,            [p 19]

line: Tho' many disasters their progress impeded:

line: His train now again poor Sir Argus tormented,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And the loss of _some_ feathers cou'd not be prevented:

line: The PARROT was ruffled, and torn, and distrest,

line: But still, _curiosity_ reign'd in his breast:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: This, _this_ was the spur that our Travellers sped,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And urg'd them both onward, tho' almost half dead.

line: At length, to their joy, at no very late hour,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But what were their feelings, when after such rambling,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: They still must encounter fresh clawing and scrambling?

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The sage Bird of Night had long chosen her station

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Aloft, where she sat in profound meditation:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The clustering Ivy her lone dwelling shaded,                       [p 20]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Which no glaring Sun-beam had ever pervaded;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Within it, the Stranger had never intruded,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And there she had liv'd, from all Idlers secluded.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: How great, then, were now her dismay and surprise;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Thrice she call'd on Minerva, and thrice rubb'd her eyes;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But doubted not long; for the Visitors now

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Came full in her presence, and made a low bow.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The Dame, tho' annoy'd, did not wish to be rude,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: So she wisely receiv'd them as well as she could.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: A frugal repast was prepar'd very soon,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Which together they shar'd, by the light of the Moon.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Some berries and seeds, the OWL thought would suffice,

line: In addition to _her_ stew of Small-birds and Mice;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And if no costly Viands awaited them here,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Keen hunger made up for the want of good cheer.

line: The supper dispatch'd, our illustrious Guest,

line: Till his Story was told, not a moment cou'd rest;

line: While the OWL her brain rummag'd, (now quite on th' alert,)        [p 21]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: For a few scraps of learning, by way of dessert:

line: But the PEACOCK had no inclination to wait,

line: And the PARROT was still more impatient to prate:

line: So the Poem was read, and the OWL vow'd she never

line: Had heard any Verses she thought half so clever.

line: But, "_who is the Author?_" this still was the theme

line: Of Sir Argus's Song, and his night and day dream.

line: Dear, sweet Mrs. OWLET, yet one favor more!

line: Acquaint us, I pray, with the name of our Poet;

line: Its worth will be doubled, to _you_ when we owe it."

line: "Dear Sir," said the Dame, who lov'd flatt'ry as well,

line: As if folly had made her a mere modern Belle,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: "Much joy would it give me to grant your request,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But, in truth, I am not of this secret possest.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: I have thought a good deal, and feel really vex'd;                 [p 22]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: For the more I consider, the more I'm perplex'd:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: However, _thus_ much I will venture to tell;

line: A _female_ alone could have written so well."

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Sir Argus believ'd the Dame _might_ have guess'd right;

line: Yet, _entre-nous_, thought her not very polite:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But that was a trifle; he now had a clew

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: To assist his research; and more satisfied grew:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Since the OWL'S well-known wisdom, and vast penetration,

line: From time immemorial had claim'd admiration.

PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But ev'ning clos'd in, and we well may suppose,

line: That our Travellers long'd for a little repose:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: While the Moon-loving Dame, who had no wish to sleep,

line: Meant in pensive delight, her lone vigil to keep:

line: So her Guests took their leave, with a friendly adieu,

line: And, forthwith, to a neighbouring Lime Tree withdrew.

line: And the LARK calls them up, at the first peep of day:

line: When, quickly descending, each shakes his bright plumes,

line: The PEACOCK is now more accustom'd to travel;

line: So, cheerfully lends his smooth wings to the breeze,

line: And with rapture extols ev'ry prospect he sees.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: O'er many a bank, with sweet violets spread,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Green field, blooming garden, and hyacinth-bed;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Thro' daisy-deck'd vallies, o'er soft swelling hills,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Across velvet-clad lawns, and beside limpid rills,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Our Travellers roam'd; till they found a young TURTLE,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Who liv'd with her Mate, in an arbour of Myrtle:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But what cou'd be learnt from two countrified DOVES,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Who were thinking, from morning to night, of their loves?

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: No! they begg'd to observe nothing _rude_ was intended,            [p 24]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But Concerts and Balls, DOVES had _never_ attended:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: In rural enjoyments _they_ pass'd time away,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And car'd for no Poems, nor Poets--not they!

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Our Birds of _haut-ton_ set them down for a pair

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Of the silliest creatures that flutter'd in air!

line: But breakfast appearing, a kind invitation

line: To share it, still met with their full approbation;

line: So both ate as much as they knew how to carry,

line: And vow'd they no longer a moment cou'd tarry:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Then hurrying off, without further ado,

line: Our Travellers now again anxiously thought

line: But _she_ was in majesty sailing away

line: They, therefore, proceeded to Turkey-Cock Farm,

line: And caus'd in the family there, some alarm:

line: But the PEACOCK his _Cousin_ most kindly embrac'd,

line: And the fright of the Youngsters was shortly effac'd:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And all were, or seem'd to be, highly delighted.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But as for the _Writer_--alas! they as soon

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Cou'd have told them the name of the Man in the Moon:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And the TURKEY-COCK'S SPOUSE her Guests calmly entreated,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: To quit the pursuit, and be quietly seated.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But all wou'd not do; so, by way of excuse,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: They pleaded a visit to good MOTHER GOOSE;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Who near, on a common, _en passant_, they saw,                     [p 26]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And had heard she had lately come out of the straw.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But the GOOSE of their tale not a word understood,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And still cackled away to her terrified brood;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: While immers'd in a pond, to complete their ill luck,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Topsy-turvy appear'd, at a distance, the DUCK!

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: What _now_ cou'd they do? why, they both persever'd,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: While the hope of succeeding their bosoms still cheer'd.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: On the WOODCOCK they call'd; on the PARTRIDGE and PHEASANT;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And, killing time thus, thought exceedingly pleasant:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Till grown somewhat weary, in order to rest,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: A sandwich they took at the GUINEA-FOWL'S nest.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But how shall we count all the visits they pay,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: To the RAVEN, the MAGPIE, the ROOK, and the JAY?

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: To the FINCHES of fashion, the GOLD and the GREEN,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: To the BLACKBIRD, the THRUSH, and the ABERDAVINE?

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: With a great many more, who were now all so busy,                  [p 27]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: To fix their attention, was not very easy.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The WREN was employ'd in constructing a nest;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And the LINNET had join'd in a song, the REDBREAST:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The BITTERN was gone to the river, to fish,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And procure, before dinner, his favorite dish:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The SWALLOW was building; the HARRIER[3] hunting,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The BANTAM was sitting, and so was the BUNTING.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: In vain, then, our Travellers hop'd to obtain

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But a word, or a hint, that might soften their pain.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: From county to county they thus made their way,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And submitted to all things, except to delay.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: From Norfolk they came up to town in a hurry,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And found themselves soon on the borders of Surry.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: From thence off to Lincoln, and Heaven knows where,                [p 28]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Till they got into Yorkshire, almost in despair:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And well might they feel nearly hopeless, indeed,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: When their rambling at last brought them down to the Tweed!

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: They look'd at each other, in silent dismay,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And the PARROT for once, cou'd not tell what to say!

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But, at length, recollecting, they turn'd short about,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Not a single jot wiser, than when they sat out.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Yet their warm bosoms still for the dear secret panted,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And this friend, and that, supplied all else they wanted.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: So, drooping and sorrowful, harrass'd and sore,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: They skimm'd the blue mountain, and cross'd the black moor,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And the PARROT, by this time quite clamorous grown,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Declar'd _he_ should die of impatience alone.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: However, consulting, they thought it was best

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Now to steer a _new_ course; so went down to the West.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: On a high Cliff, in Cornwall, they found out the CHOUGH;           [p 29]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But how shou'd _he_ learn what was passing below?

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Thro' Devon, so fam'd for its picturesque views,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: They pass'd with a haste one can scarcely excuse;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: From thence got to Somerset, almost benighted,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And soon on the summit of Mendip alighted.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: There, most _à propos_, they immediately found

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: A Moss-cover'd Root-house,[4] with evergreens bound;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Beneath whose kind shelter, fatigu'd and opprest,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: They gladly agreed till the morning to rest.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: SIR ARGUS now cried, with a sigh and a tear,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: "I wish that our travels, my friend, could end _here_:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Yet dread lest we many miles further should go,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And never, at last, our sweet Poetess know!"

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But Fortune, capricious, who sports at her leisure,                [p 30]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: With birds, as with men, when it suits her good pleasure,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Resolv'd, after teazing Sir Argus awhile,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: To reward, in the end, all his toils with her smile.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Aurora with splendor unusual arose,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: When the PEACOCK and PARROT awoke from repose,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And how were their bosoms delighted and cheer'd,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: When before them a perfect Elysium appear'd!

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Reluctant they left it, again to explore,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Unconscious what happiness yet was in store:

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But the country they travers'd was smiling and gay,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: While the Sun, brightly shining, illumin'd their way;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And we all know how cheerful, how sweet is the scene,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: When Nature unfolds her new livery of green.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: The Birds carol'd round them, the Butterfly play'd,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And the soft vernal breeze kindly lent them its aid.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: [Illustration: _"Till, all their cares over, in DORSET they found her."

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Thus, gently reviving, Hope sooth'd them again,                    [p 31]

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And they shortly forgot both their sorrow and pain.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: A path strew'd with flowers, they gaily pursued,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And, in fancy, their long-sought Incognita view'd;

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Till, _all their cares over_, in DORSET[5] they found her

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And, plucking a wreath of green Bay-leaves, they _crown'd_ her.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Now, what more remains of our PEACOCK to say,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: But that, homeward, triumphant, he wing'd back his way,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: Proclaim'd his success to the whole Biped Nation,

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: And proudly accepted their congratulation.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: [1] The Song of "Pretty, pretty Poll," in the Beggar's Opera.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: [2] Vide "The Peacock at Home."

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: [3] The HEN HARRIER--a bird of prey, of the Hawk tribe.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: [4] A Moss-cover'd Root-house, in the Plantation at Mendip Lodge--the

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: charming seat of the Rev. Dr. Whalley.

Poem Title: PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
line: [5] Mrs. DORSET was the _Authoress_ of "_The Peacock at Home._"

PRINTED FOR J. HARRIS, CORNER OF ST. PAUL'S.
